intro: Corynanthe pachyceras, commonly known as the thick-shelled snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its thick, woody roots and simple, opposite leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Corynanthe pachyceras is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
